result.execSummary:
The defendant Maliik Jenemiaa Gracy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Maliik Jenemiaa Gracy is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Maliik Jenemiaa Gracy was found guilty of Endangering Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (Detectable Amount of Controlled Substance), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(bm).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered the defendant to pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge by 9-26-17. Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgment.

Huber privileges for medical/AODA/batterers treatment/school and child care. Sentence to commence forthwith.
Consecutive to: any sentence with credit for 2 days served
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (Detectable Amount of Controlled Substance)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maliik Jenemiaa Gracy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Maliik Jenemiaa Gracy
Current: 5001 N 54th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218 United States  (Effective: 10-17-2014)
Prior: 3288 North 24th Place, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Defendant Maliik Jenemiaa Gracy in court with attorney Robert G. LeBell.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Branch 15 for Branch 3

On motion of the state, pursuant to plea negotiations, Court orderd COUNTS 2 and 3 DISMISSED

AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY:
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms. 

  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Rickeshai M.,  Valetha H.

  Court sentenced defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 2 days served; Huber privileges for medical/aoda/batters treatment/school and child care. Sentence to commence forthwith.

Court ordered the defendant to pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge by 09-26-17.  Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgement.

Appeal rights given
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed. aw

Defendant to make all contacts with Justice Point.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Maliik Jenemiaa Gracy in court with attorney Robert G. LeBell.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Laura Crivello.
Court addresses violation report dated 7/7/2014.  Defendant tested positive on 7/3/2014, and had the test challenged.  Test came back positive.  Court modifies conditions of release.  Case adjoruned for scheduling conference on 8/11/2014 at 10:00 am, branch 3.  Defendant taken into custody.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Court is adding drug testing to his Justice Point monitioring.

Attorney Robert G LeBell in court, defendant Maliik Jenemiaa Gracy not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Laura Crivello.
Defense counsel has just received discovery, and requests time to review.  Case adjourned for schedling conference on 7/11/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maliik Jenemiaa Gracy in court with attorney Robert G LeBell.  Denis Stingl for Laura Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was incorrectly substituted.  Court orders case transferred from Branch 15, clerk of court office supervisor was contacted, case is now re-assigned to Branch 3, Judge Fiorenza.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.

Defendant Maliik Jenemiaa Gracy in court with attorney Robert G LeBell.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 5/7/14.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Maliik Jenemiaa Gracy in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Maliik Jenemiaa Gracy in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
